ul.li: Typically, each assignment is done by a group of two students. The programming results of it are shown to the instructor who validates it during a laboratory session. You can register to a laboratory group here: https://sam.cs.lth.se/LabsSelectSession?occasionId=552.

After the lab, each and every student writes a report of one to two pages to describe how s/he carried out the assignment, her/his results, and gives a conclusion. You need both to validate your program and hand in a short report to complete your assignment. You can use overleaf to write this report.
Attendance to the laboratory sessions is compulsory. If you are unable to attend, you must report it to your instructor.

We will use Python and scikit-learn in the assignments. The laboratory session of week 1 (lab 0) is intended to review some basic features of Python as well as scikit-learn.
Group 1/2, September 4, 2018, 08:15 to 10:00, in the Beta room, group 3, September 4, 2018, 13:15 to 15:00, in the Beta room, and group 4, September 4, 2018, 15:15 to 17:00, in the Beta room.
Anaconda and Pycharm are the recommended programming environments. Both are free.

Lab zero: In this lab, we will review Python and scikit-learn. Attending this lab is not compulsory, but you need to run the spell checker by Peter Norvig to make sure you understand Python. You also have to hand in a short individual report describing the program. The report length should be of one to two pages.
